document_data.name: Rot Grub
document_data.mainbody: '''Rot grubs''', or '''tenebrio puterus''',{{Cite dragon/49/Monster Mixing|40}} were a species of parasitic grubs.
document_data.Abilities: If their victims were quick, they could be treated with [[fire]] or by cutting them out with a blade. If not, a ''[[remove disease]]'' spell would be needed to eliminate them before they reached a victim's heart.{{Cite dragon/122/The Ecology of the Rot Grub|16-17}}
document_data.History: In [[1357 DR]], rot grubs could occasionally be found in the [[sewers of Waterdeep]].

Ecology.Diet: Rot grubs were known to feed upon both dead and living flesh.
Ecology.Habitats:
In the forest of [[Cormanthor]], rot grubs were often found in the bark of [[treant]]s, where they helped combat [[tube wilt]] by eating the rotten wood and the fungal infection that caused it.

Outside of Cormanthor, they were most often found in piles of offal or [[dung]], attracted by movement, they would burrow into the nearest moving object and eat whatever they could.
Ecology.Usages: Some [[gnoll]]s were known to capture rot grubs and use them to torture their captives in rites to [[Yeenoghu]]. Some [[kobold]]s would capture them and place them in small, [[ceramic]] containers to be thrown at their enemies. And some [[bugbear]]s were known to use them as additions to their [[trap]]s or pits to dispose of bodies in.
